intro: Barhamia essequiboensis, commonly known as the Essequibo barhamia, is a rare and unique plant species native to the Guyana Shield region. It is a member of the Ruprikeliales order and is characterized by its small, clustered growth habit. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with a short, thick stem and a dense rosette of leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
